Engaging in pillage and looting is prohibited.

chapter_title: 1.2 International Legal Framework

testimonies.excerpt: Several Ossetian civilians reported looting by Georgian ground forces but otherwise generally did not complain of other abusive treatment.

violations.description: Georgian forces conducted indiscriminate shelling in Tskhinvali, violating international humanitarian law.

violations.label: Use of BM-21s in Civilian Areas
violations.description: Georgia's use of multiple rocket launching systems in civilian populated areas violated the principle of distinction under international humanitarian law.

violations.label: Ill-treatment of Detainees
violations.description: Those detained by Georgian forces reported ill-treatment when taken into custody.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Georgian Forces Shell Tskhinvali
events.description: On the night of August 7-8, Georgian forces subjected Tskhinvali and nearby villages to heavy shelling.

events.label: Daytime Shelling of Tskhinvali
events.description: Tskhinvali was heavily shelled during daytime hours on August 8.

events.label: Resumed Shelling Targeting Russian Troops
events.description: Shelling resumed at a smaller scale on August 9, targeting Russian troops in Tskhinvali.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

violations.description: Georgian forces used Grad rockets, self-propelled artillery, mortars, and Howitzer cannons in attacks.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Shelling of Tskhinvali Hospital
events.description: The South Ossetian Central Republican Hospital was shelled for 18 hours, forcing staff to treat wounded in the basement.

events.label: Aivar Bestaev's House Hit
events.description: Aivar Bestaev learned that his house was hit and on fire while he was performing surgery at the hospital.

testimonies.excerpt: I came to work on August 7, and couldn’t leave the hospital for almost a week. We treated all of the wounded in the basement.

violations.description: Shelling of civilian objects, including the hospital, which is protected under international law.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Grad Rockets Hit Tskhinvali
events.description: Five Grad rockets struck the yards of Vladimir's house and his neighbor's house, causing destruction.

testimonies.excerpt: Five Grad rockets hit my yard and my neighbor’s yard on August 7.

violations.description: Attacks on hospitals violate humanitarian law as they are protected civilian objects.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Grad Rockets Hit Stalin Street
events.description: Several apartment buildings on Stalin Street were hit by Grad rockets, causing significant damage and injuries.

testimonies.excerpt: When the shelling started, my friends rushed to the basement... they spent two days and two nights there, unable to get out.
The building was hit by three Grad rockets almost simultaneously at around 4:20 a.m.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages
2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Grad Shelling in Khetagurovo
events.description: Georgian forces subjected Khetagurovo to Grad shelling and heavy artillery fire, resulting in significant destruction.

testimonies.excerpt: At night the shelling started … it was absolutely horrifying. We spent three days in our neighbors’ basement—there was no food, nothing.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attack
violations.description: The use of Grad rockets in populated areas may constitute an indiscriminate attack, endangering civilians.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Indiscriminate Use of Force by Georgian Forces
events.description: Georgian forces' use of Grad and other weapons resulted in civilian deaths and injuries.

events.label: Parliamentary Session on Military Aggression
events.description: A session of the Parliamentary ad hoc Commission discussed military aggression and acts against Georgia.

events.label: Public Commission Reports Civilian Deaths
events.description: The Public Commission for Investigation of War Crimes reported 34 civilian deaths due to Grad rockets.
actors: Public Commission for Investigation of War Crimes

testimonies.excerpt: Georgian forces’ indiscriminate use of force led to civilian deaths and injuries.
Georgian police posts were often fired at from the villages of Khetagurovo and Ubaiti.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Shelling of Tskhinvali Begins
events.description: The shelling of Tskhinvali commenced, resulting in casualties and destruction.

events.label: Dzhagaev Injured During Shelling
events.description: Anisim Dzhagaev was injured by a Grad rocket while trying to extinguish a fire caused by shelling.

events.label: Georgian Shelling Kills Civilians
events.description: Two women were killed during a round of Georgian shelling near School No. 6 in Tskhinvali.

events.label: Neighbor Killed While Fetching Water
events.description: Vasily Bazaev was killed by a shell while attempting to leave the basement for water.

events.label: Natela Wounded by Shell Fragments
events.description: Natela was wounded by shell fragments while trying to reach a safer basement.

testimonies.excerpt: He stepped out of the basement during the shelling to see what was happening and saw that the roof of the house had caught fire.
When it hit, all the sharp, scorching fragments flew into the house, penetrating the walls as if it was paper.
We stayed in the same basement next to his body till the afternoon of August 9, when some relatives came to pick up the body.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Shelling of Civilians
violations.description: Georgian forces conducted indiscriminate shelling that resulted in civilian casualties.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Civilians Begin Evacuating Tskhinvali
events.description: Many residents, especially women and children, evacuated or fled their homes before the fighting began.

events.label: Saakashvili Announces Ceasefire
events.description: President Saakashvili stated that Georgia has unilaterally ceased fire and would engage in negotiations.

testimonies.excerpt: A number of witnesses told Human Rights Watch that this announcement influenced their decision to stay in the city.

violations.label: Failure to Minimize Civilian Risk
violations.description: The Georgian side failed to minimize the risk to civilians and did not provide advance warning of the attack.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

testimonies.excerpt: Georgian forces used precision targeting ground weapons only against several administrative buildings, where headquarters of militias were located.
The goal of the attacks was only to neutralize firing positions from where Georgian positions were being targeted.
Militias had taken up positions in School No. 12 in the southern part of Tskhinvali, which was seriously damaged by the Georgian fire.

violations.label: Use of Civilian Infrastructure for Military Purposes
violations.description: South Ossetian forces set up defensive positions or headquarters in civilian infrastructure, turning them into legitimate military targets.

chapter_title: 2.2 Indiscriminate Shelling of Tskhinvali and Outlying Villages

events.label: Georgian Forces Shell Tskhinvali
events.description: Georgian forces conducted large-scale shelling against Tskhinvali and surrounding villages, raising questions about the proportionality of the attacks.

testimonies.excerpt: The fighters in the basement peeked out but did not open fire at Georgian forces.
Fragments of Grad rockets hit my kindergarten building.
Many school and nursery buildings were used as gathering points by the militias.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks on Civilians
violations.description: Georgian forces used indiscriminate weapons in populated areas, violating international humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Civilians Attempt to Flee to North Ossetia
events.description: Many Ossetian civilians tried to escape to North Ossetia during the fighting, facing attacks on their vehicles.

events.label: Georgian Attacks on Fleeing Civilians
events.description: Reports emerged of Georgian attacks on civilian vehicles fleeing the conflict zone, leading to casualties.

violations.label: Attacks on Civilians
violations.description: Georgian forces conducted attacks on civilian vehicles, resulting in excessive civilian loss and failure to protect civilian life.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: Attack on the Dzhusoev family, August 8

events.label: Shelling Incident in Tskhinvali
events.description: A civilian car was attacked by a Georgian tank while attempting to leave Tskhinvali, resulting in multiple casualties.

testimonies.excerpt: I didn’t want to let them go, but my son said, 'Dad, not to worry, I’ll get through!' ... I only found out around 4 p.m., but then I couldn’t do anything.

violations.label: Attack on Civilians
violations.description: The attack on Mairbek Dzhusoev's civilian car by a Georgian tank constitutes a violation of humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: Attacks on civilian cars on the Dzara road

events.label: Petr Petaev's Family Attacked While Fleeing
events.description: Petr Petaev and his family were shot at while trying to flee Tskhinvali, resulting in the death of his wife and injuries to him and his son.

events.label: Diana Kodjaeva Killed During Evacuation
events.description: Diana Kodjaeva was killed while attempting to flee Tskhinvali with her neighbors on the night of August 7-8.

testimonies.excerpt: We got into our car in the evening and drove out of the city. Some militias told us that a humanitarian corridor was opening up that evening and everyone should try to leave.
I learnt about her death the next day.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Car Comes Under Fire on Dzara Road
events.description: A car carrying a family came under heavy fire from Georgian troops, resulting in a burnt wreck and trauma for the survivors.

testimonies.excerpt: I found what remained of the car. It was a burnt wreck. I just picked up a few handfuls of dust from the car and pretended these were her ashes.
On the detour road, the car came under heavy fire from the Georgian troops. My brother first pushed his wife and son out of the car and they hid in a ditch.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions by Georgian Forces
violations.description: An unverified claim that Georgian forces used cluster munitions in their attacks.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: Dzara road is discussed in Chapter 2.4).

events.label: Russian Forces Move South from Roki Tunnel
events.description: Starting early on the evening of August 8, Russian forces and armaments began moving south from the Roki tunnel on the Dzara road.

testimonies.excerpt: The circumstances of these killings warrant further investigation.

violations.label: Georgian Forces' Duty to Minimize Civilian Harm
violations.description: Georgian forces had a duty to take precautions to minimize civilian harm and ensure attacks conformed to the principle of proportionality.

chapter_title: 2.3 Attacks by Georgian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

violations.description: Georgian troops failed to distinguish between civilian objects and legitimate military targets, potentially violating humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.4 Georgian Forces’ Ground Offensive

events.label: Georgian Troops Enter Tskhinvali
events.description: In the early hours, Georgian ground troops, including tanks and infantry, entered South Ossetian villages and Tskhinvali, claiming control by the afternoon.

events.label: Georgian Command Orders Withdrawal
events.description: The Georgian command ordered the withdrawal of troops from South Ossetia after ongoing exchanges of fire.

testimonies.excerpt: We entered Tskhinvali in the morning of August 8. There was a street fight. Ossetians were mostly in the buildings, in apartments, and shot at us from the buildings.
We could see civilians in the basements. Some would come up and peek out to see what was happening on the street level.

violations.label: Excessive Civilian Loss
violations.description: Georgian troops acted with disregard to civilian protection by launching attacks that predictably caused excessive civilian loss.

chapter_title: 2.4 Georgian Forces’ Ground Offensive
section_title: Georgian tank fire. © 2008 Human Rights Watch

events.label: BMP Fires into Basement
events.description: An infantry fighting vehicle fired into the basement of an apartment building, causing severe damage.

testimonies.excerpt: When the fighting started, everyone who remained in the building rushed to the basement. We stayed there for the next two days, unable to step outside because the shelling was so heavy.

chapter_title: 2.4 Georgian Forces’ Ground Offensive

events.label: Georgian Tank Shelling in Tskhinvali
events.description: At around 3:30 p.m., a Georgian tank opened fire on an apartment building, resulting in civilian casualties and property damage.

testimonies.excerpt: Residents of Tselinnikov Street reported that a Georgian tank opened fire at their apartment building.

violations.description: The Georgian military did not take all feasible precautions to minimize harm to civilians during the attack.

chapter_title: 2.4 Georgian Forces’ Ground Offensive
section_title: Building residents told Human Rights Watch,

events.label: Georgian Forces Enter Khetagurovo
events.description: Georgian ground forces entered the village of Khetagurovo, spraying bullets and demanding the surrender of Ossetian militias.

events.label: Elderly Woman Killed by Stray Bullet
events.description: An elderly woman, Anastasia Dzhioeva, was killed by a stray bullet while feeding chickens in her yard during the Georgian offensive.

events.label: Destruction of Novyi Tbeti
events.description: The village of Novyi Tbeti was almost completely destroyed by Georgian artillery and tank fire.

testimonies.excerpt: We rushed to the basement, but an elderly man didn’t make it in time and burned to ashes.
At dawn, the Georgians entered the village—first the tanks, and then the infantry. They were shooting in all directions.
I saw two Georgian tanks on the street, and one of those tanks fired right at my house, causing shrapnel wounds.

violations.label: Failure to Protect Civilians
violations.description: The Georgian offensive was carried out with little regard for the safety of civilians, violating humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.4 Georgian Forces’ Ground Offensive

events.label: Georgian Forces Enter Znauri
events.description: Georgian ground forces arrived in Znauri looking for fighters and arms, treating residents roughly and stealing money.

events.label: Georgian Forces Enter Villages
events.description: Georgian forces entered several villages, reportedly not harming civilians and searching for Ossetian fighters.

testimonies.excerpt: Georgian soldiers told us they were instructed to kill the young guys only and not to touch women and children.
I was terrified when Georgian troops entered the village, but they were polite and did not harm me.
Georgian soldiers assured us they had not killed any residents and were not going to.
They told us not to be afraid and said that if our men wouldn’t shoot, they wouldn’t shoot either.

violations.label: Ransacking and Theft by Georgian Forces
violations.description: Georgian forces ransacked homes and stole money and valuables from residents while searching for fighters.

chapter_title: 2.4 Georgian Forces’ Ground Offensive

testimonies.excerpt: They forced me to open it for them and took all the money.
Georgian soldiers stole whatever money she had at the house, as well as the passports of the residents.
They tore everything apart. They still noticed and took [it] from me.

violations.label: Looting and Pillaging by Georgian Forces
violations.description: Georgian forces engaged in looting and pillaging, violating international humanitarian law.

events.label: Georgian Ministry Acknowledges Use of Cluster Munitions
events.description: The Georgian Ministry of Defense confirmed the use of cluster munitions against Russian military equipment moving south from the Roki tunnel.

events.label: Convention on Cluster Munitions Opened for Signing
events.description: The international treaty banning cluster munitions was opened for signing in Oslo, Norway.

events.label: Signing Conference for Cluster Munitions Treaty
events.description: By the end of the signing conference, 94 nations had signed the Convention on Cluster Munitions.

events.label: Adoption of the Convention on Cluster Munitions
events.description: 107 nations adopted a new international treaty in Dublin, Ireland, banning the use of cluster munitions.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions in Civilian Areas
violations.description: The use of M85 cluster munitions by Georgian forces resulted in civilian casualties and damage to civilian infrastructure.

events.label: Georgian Armed Forces Use Cluster Munitions
events.description: The Georgian Ministry of Defense reported the use of GRAD-LAR munitions during the August war, specifically 24 packages of Mk-4 rockets with M85 submunitions.

testimonies.excerpt: I saw a rocket which exploded in the air, and then small clusters started exploding.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions Against Civilians
violations.description: Allegations of Georgian forces using cluster munitions in attacks, which could constitute a violation of humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.5 Georgia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: Interviews with Norwegian People’s Aid

events.label: Attribution of M85 Strikes Withdrawn
events.description: Human Rights Watch withdrew the attribution of M85 cluster strikes to Russian forces after further investigation.

testimonies.excerpt: Human Rights Watch interviewed First Deputy Minister of Defense Batu Kutelia.

events.label: Investigation into M85 Submunitions
events.description: Georgian authorities announced an investigation into the presence of M85 submunitions in the Gori district.

testimonies.excerpt: The presence of M85 submunitions in villages in the Gori district remained a mystery to the Georgian authorities.

chapter_title: 2.5 Georgia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: Civilian Casualties from M85 Submunitions
events.description: In Gori district, M85 submunitions exploded, resulting in the death of Vano Gogidze and injuries to his brother Ketino.

testimonies.excerpt: Vano Gogidze was killed and his brother Ketino was injured when M85 submunitions exploded in Shindisi.
A villager showed Human Rights Watch an Mk-4 rocket and red ribbon in Variani.

violations.label: Use of M85 Submunitions
violations.description: The use of M85 submunitions, which pose grave danger to civilians, constitutes a violation of humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.5 Georgia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: M85 Submunitions Strike Tirdznisi
events.description: M85 submunitions landed in Tirdznisi, injuring Alexander Zerekhidze around 3:30 a.m.

testimonies.excerpt: I heard some noise... something exploded. I turned back and shrapnel hit my back, stomach, leg.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions
violations.description: The use of M85 submunitions in populated areas constitutes a violation of humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.5 Georgia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: Inspection of Unexploded Ordnance in Shindisi
events.description: Several men from Shindisi inspected a site where a strike had landed the previous day and found unexploded ordnance.

events.label: Explosion of Cluster Duds in Brotsleti
events.description: Alika Kikvilashvili and others encountered cluster duds that exploded, resulting in fatalities and injuries.

testimonies.excerpt: I was surprised about the finding of unexploded M85 submunitions without self-destruct devices.
I saw two small items that looked like light sockets; then the cluster duds exploded.

violations.label: Use of Unexploded M85 Submunitions
violations.description: The use of M85 submunitions that failed to self-destruct led to civilian casualties.

chapter_title: 2.5 Georgia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

testimonies.excerpt: I had shrapnel all around and it is still inside—stomach, right and left arms, right and left legs. I felt it only later.

chapter_title: 2.5 Georgia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: Durmiskhan Bedianashvili Reports Death
events.description: Durmiskhan Bedianashvili reported that his father, Veliko Bedianashvili, died after an unexploded M85 submunition exploded.

events.label: Unexploded M85 Submunition Incident
events.description: Veliko Bedianashvili found an unexploded M85 submunition which exploded while he was trying to remove it.

testimonies.excerpt: I am not going to my fields. The harvest is now ready, but there is grass and it is hard to notice anything.
There are so many of those lying around. The fields are full of them.

testimonies.excerpt: Georgian soldiers were dragging pregnant women out of houses and beating and killing them for delectation of the crowd.

violations.label: Civilians Executed in Church
violations.description: In the village of Tsinagar, Georgian forces executed all civilians who sought refuge in a church.

violations.description: Georgian soldiers were reported to have dragged pregnant women from their homes and killed them.

violations.description: A child was shot dead while being protected by their mother from Georgian forces.

violations.description: Mikheil Saakashvili inaccurately stated that Tskhinvali had been 'flattened' by Russian forces, misusing Human Rights Watch as a source.

events.description: Between August 6 and 11, Tskhinvali hospital received 44 bodies and treated 273 wounded individuals.

events.description: As of August 13, there were no wounded individuals remaining in Tskhinvali hospital.

violations.label: Concerns Over Casualty Figures

chapter_title: 2.8 Georgian Detentions and Ill-Treatment of Ossetians

events.label: Georgian Military Detains Ossetians
events.description: The Georgian military detained at least 32 Ossetians during active combat in South Ossetia.

events.label: Exchange of Detainees
events.description: Between August 21 and 27, 32 Ossetians were released in exchange for Georgian civilian detainees.

testimonies.excerpt: We were beaten by Georgian soldiers at the moment of our detention and received poor food while in detention.
I am a pacifist on religious grounds, questioning the Georgian government’s determination about detainees.
I traveled to South Ossetia to join the militia forces as a volunteer before the Georgian military attacked.

violations.label: Detention of Civilians
violations.description: The detention of Ossetians by the Georgian military raises concerns about the treatment of civilians under the Fourth Geneva Convention.

chapter_title: 2.8 Georgian Detentions and Ill-Treatment of Ossetians

violations.description: Detention of civilians must follow regular procedures under international humanitarian law.
Ossetians not entitled to POW status are treated as non-privileged combatants.

chapter_title: 2.8 Georgian Detentions and Ill-Treatment of Ossetians

violations.description: Georgia's ill-treatment of Ossetian detainees violated the prohibition on torture and degrading treatment.
Georgia did not derogate from ICCPR and ECHR obligations regarding arbitrary detention during the conflict.
International humanitarian law strictly forbids hostage-taking, which occurred during the conflict.

violations.label: Extensive Hostage-Taking Documented
violations.description: Human Rights Watch documented extensive hostage-taking following the 1991-92 conflict in South Ossetia.

chapter_title: 2.8 Georgian Detentions and Ill-Treatment of Ossetians

events.label: Oleg Tikaev Detained by Georgian Forces
events.description: Oleg Tikaev was detained by Georgian military forces in Khetagurovo, where he was threatened and beaten.

events.label: Sergei Lokhov Detained by Georgian Forces
events.description: Sergei Lokhov was detained in Khetagurovo by Georgian soldiers who ignored his civilian status and beat him.

events.label: Nodar Butlotaev Beaten by Georgian Soldiers
events.description: Nodar Butlotaev was reportedly beaten by Georgian soldiers during his detention in Khetagurovo.

testimonies.excerpt: They surprised me in the street, threatened to kill me, shot in the air several times, and pointed their guns at me.
They were really beating me all the time in Avnevi, in Karteli, on the way to Gori.
They asked me, 'Why are the Russians bombing us?' ... I said, 'Kokoity?' They hit me and asked again.
Nodar Butlotaev reported having been beaten by Georgian soldiers when they detained him in Khetagurovo.

violations.label: Beating of Oleg Tikaev
violations.description: Oleg Tikaev was beaten by Georgian military forces during his detention.

violations.label: Beating of Nodar Butlotaev
violations.description: Nodar Butlotaev was beaten by Georgian soldiers, resulting in an open head wound.

events.label: Georgian Forces Detain Ivan Bosikov
events.description: Ivan Bosikov, a volunteer fighter from North Ossetia, was detained by Georgian forces near Tskhinvali.

events.description: Bosikov and other detainees were held in the prosecutor’s office in Gori and beaten.

testimonies.excerpt: I was detained near Tskhinvali and beaten while held in Gori.

testimonies.excerpt: I told them weapons were wrong and fighting was wrong. They hit me in the head and dragged me off.
[The Georgian soldiers] beat me up first and took me away with them. They hit me and hit me again.

chapter_title: 3.1 Overview

testimonies.excerpt: Many of the Russian servicemen who occupied Georgia behaved in a disciplined manner and in some cases even protected the civilian population.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks by Russian Forces
violations.description: Russian forces committed violations of international humanitarian law by conducting indiscriminate attacks using aerial, artillery, and tank fire strikes.

violations.label: Attacks on Medical Personnel
violations.description: Russia attacked medical personnel, constituting a grave breach of the Geneva Conventions and a war crime.

violations.label: Deliberate Attacks on Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces may have intentionally targeted civilians during military operations, amounting to war crimes.

violations.label: Pillaging and Violence Against Civilians
violations.description: Russian servicemen committed violations such as pillaging, destruction of civilian property, and using violence against civilians.

violations.label: Failure to Ensure Public Safety
violations.description: Russia failed in its duty as an occupying power to ensure public safety and order, allowing South Ossetian forces to engage in violence against civilians.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Forces Attack Gori and Villages
events.description: Between August 8 and 12, Russian forces attacked Georgian military targets in Gori and ethnic Georgian villages, causing civilian casualties.

events.label: Intensified Shelling of Ethnic Georgian Villages
events.description: From August 8 to August 10, ethnic Georgian villages in South Ossetia faced intensified artillery shelling and aerial bombardments.

testimonies.excerpt: Residents of several ethnic Georgian villages said their villages had been shelled intermittently by South Ossetian forces.

violations.label: Violation of Proportionality Principle
violations.description: Russian forces attacked military targets near civilian objects, violating the principle of proportionality and potentially targeting civilians.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks on Villages
violations.description: The artillery shelling of ethnic Georgian villages may have been indiscriminate, violating international humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Artillery Shelling Begins in Kekhvi
events.description: Residents reported that artillery shelling started at 11:30 p.m. and continued throughout the night.

events.label: Aerial Bombing Starts in Kekhvi
events.description: Aerial bombing began at 6 a.m. and continued until 3 p.m., with artillery shelling persisting throughout the day.

events.label: Massive Bombing in Kekhvi
events.description: On August 9, massive bombing occurred, destroying village administration and hospital buildings.

testimonies.excerpt: The shelling started on August 7, at 11:30 p.m. There were no gunshots, just the blast.
On August 9 massive bombing started and the village administration and hospital buildings were destroyed.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

testimonies.excerpt: The village school was destroyed. Kekhvi residents named at least three villagers killed by shrapnel during the attacks.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Shelling of Kvemo Achabeti
events.description: The village of Kvemo Achabeti was shelled on August 8 and 9.

events.label: Shelling of Kvemo Achabeti
events.description: The village of Kvemo Achabeti was shelled on August 8 and 9.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks
section_title: Human Rights Watch that four houses were hit:

events.label: Bombing of House in Kheiti
events.description: A bomb fell into the yard of a house in Kheiti, causing significant damage and injuring a child.

events.label: Nugzar Bugianishvili Killed in Aerial Attack
events.description: Nugzar Bugianishvili died during a Russian aerial attack while having a meal with his family.

testimonies.excerpt: We were hiding in the basement, which is concrete. The concrete on top of the basement protected us.
I got up from the table and went to the basement. That’s when a bomb hit [our house] and shrapnel hit my brother.

violations.label: Russian Aerial Attack Resulting in Civilian Casualties
violations.description: The aerial attack by Russian forces resulted in the death of Nugzar Bugianishvili and injuries to others.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Civilians Begin to Flee Gori
events.description: As a result of airstrikes and advancing Russian and Ossetian forces, civilians started to evacuate Gori.

events.label: Georgia Concentrates Artillery in Gori
events.description: In mid-July 2008, Georgia moved its entire artillery brigade to Gori city in preparation for potential conflict.

violations.label: Russian Air Strikes Targeting Military Base
violations.description: Russian air strikes targeted the military base and reservists in Gori city.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks
section_title: Attack on Apartment Buildings on Sukhishvili Street

events.label: Russian Airstrike on Gori
events.description: Russian aircraft targeted a military base in Gori, hitting three apartment buildings, resulting in 14 deaths and numerous injuries.

testimonies.excerpt: I was walking down the stairs when I heard a loud explosion. I live in the third entryway and the bomb hit the first one.

violations.description: Russian forces failed to observe the laws of war regarding targeting and proportionality by hitting civilian buildings.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Bombing on Sukhishvili Street
events.description: A bombing incident occurred, resulting in casualties and destruction as people attempted to flee.

testimonies.excerpt: A young couple was getting into a car to run away after the first bomb hit the apartment. But as they were preparing to flee a second bomb fell and they were hit by shrapnel and died.
People were thrown out of the windows. There was complete panic. Many people were wounded.

violations.description: Indiscriminate bombing resulting in civilian casualties.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Airstrikes on Gori School
events.description: Russian aircraft conducted strikes on and near School No. 7 in Gori, resulting in civilian casualties and damage to nearby buildings.

events.label: Civilian Casualties from Airstrike
events.description: The airstrike resulted in the deaths of at least five civilians and injuries to at least 18 others.

testimonies.excerpt: I was at the school when the bombing took place; about one hundred reservists were in the yard.

violations.description: The attack on the school, which was being used for military purposes, raises questions about the legality of targeting civilian objects.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

testimonies.excerpt: At the time of the interview Zerekidze lived in a garage behind the apartment building together with her 75-year-old neighbor Tina Khanishvili.
Human Rights Watch interview with Tina Khanishvili, Gori, August 19, 2008.
Human Rights Watch interview with Lia Kobesashvili, Tbilisi, August 18, 2008.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Bombing of School No. 7
events.description: A bomb hit the building next to School No. 7, causing significant damage and chaos.

testimonies.excerpt: I got there around 11 a.m. and saw that there were Georgian reservist forces in the yard.

violations.description: The attack on the school raises questions about the proportionality of the attack and the obligation to minimize civilian harm.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Helicopter Attacks Hospital Staff
events.description: A Russian military helicopter fired a rocket at hospital staff members in Gori, resulting in the death of physician Giorgi Abramishvili.

violations.label: Attack on Medical Personnel
violations.description: The attack on the Gori Military Hospital staff constitutes a serious violation of international humanitarian law, as hospitals are not legitimate military targets.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Air and Artillery Attacks on Karbi
events.description: On the morning of August 9, Russian air and artillery attacks struck the village of Karbi, resulting in multiple casualties.

events.label: Aerial-Burst Artillery Shells Hit Gathering Residents
events.description: As residents gathered to flee, aerial-burst artillery shells killed at least seven and injured at least 10.

testimonies.excerpt: It was completely quiet; then I heard an explosion and saw yellow smoke. The pressure from the explosion was so strong that it lifted me up.
My wife was killed by shrapnel from the artillery attack.

violations.description: Russian air and artillery attacks resulted in civilian casualties, including deaths and injuries.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Aerial Bombing in Karbi
events.description: Aerial bombing resulted in multiple casualties, including the death of four individuals and injuries to several others.

testimonies.excerpt: I was wounded in the stomach. Four people died around me. I ran into the yard, shouting for my wife to help me, but she was already dead.
I was also wounded during the second attack and corroborated Gaioz Bidzinashvili’s story.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

testimonies.excerpt: I went to buy bread. On the way, I saw men gathered in the neighborhood center, listening to the radio. My son was also there. When I approached them, I heard loud explosions and I was wounded.
There were many wounded. I had to decide who had better chances of survival and stuff them into the ambulance. We buried the dead in the yards of houses and fled the village.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attack on Civilians
violations.description: The village was hit twice in two separate attacks, suggesting deliberate targeting or indiscriminate attack by Russian forces.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Aircraft Attack on Tortiza
events.description: At around 9:45 a.m., Russian aircraft fired S-8 rockets at Tortiza, resulting in three civilian deaths and numerous injuries.

testimonies.excerpt: A bomb hit the house. He [Nugzar] turned around and shrapnel hit him. He said, 'I think I’m wounded,' and that’s it.
We felt the territory was very safe. We are not on the main road. We are in the middle of nowhere.

violations.description: Attack on civilians in Tortiza resulting in deaths and injuries.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Rocket Attack on Tortiza
events.description: A series of S-8 rocket attacks by Russian forces targeted civilian houses in Tortiza, resulting in multiple injuries and fatalities.

testimonies.excerpt: It happened in a second. It became dark all of a sudden... I fell, was not feeling my right leg and it was all torn apart.
I was sitting in the yard of my house eating ice cream when I heard noise from flying jets... I heard my son screaming for help.
I heard jets flying over... It broke the windows and doors. The debris was so thick in the air that nothing was visible.

violations.label: Attack on Civilian Structures
violations.description: Russian forces conducted attacks on civilian houses in Tortiza, resulting in injuries and destruction.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

violations.description: Direct attack on a purely civilian target constitutes a serious violation of humanitarian law and a war crime.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Russian Aircraft Bombs Tkviavi
events.description: A Russian aircraft bombed a neighborhood in Tkviavi, destroying homes and wounding two civilians.

testimonies.excerpt: I was in the village at the time of the bombing.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

events.label: Airstrike on Village
events.description: A jet dropped four bombs on the village, causing significant damage to nearby houses.

testimonies.excerpt: I ran home to see my house damaged and my neighbor’s house almost completely destroyed.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks
section_title: The top floor of Merebashvili’s house was damaged.

events.label: Russian Airstrike on Akhaldaba
events.description: Russian aircraft fired S-8 rockets on the village of Akhaldaba, injuring five people during a 10-minute attack.

testimonies.excerpt: I had finished washing the dishes... I felt pain, and I was screaming and I lost consciousness.
Villagers told Human Rights Watch that there were no Georgian military forces in the village at the time of the attack.

chapter_title: 3.2 Aerial Bombardments, Shelling, and Artillery Attacks

testimonies.excerpt: I was near my house, in the yard, when one rocket hit the house. Several others fell in my yard.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks on Civilian Targets
violations.description: The attacks on Tkviavi and Akhaldaba may have been direct attacks on civilian targets, constituting war crimes.

chapter_title: 3.3 Russia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: Use of Cluster Munitions in Gori and Kareli
events.description: Russian forces used cluster munitions against populated areas, resulting in civilian casualties and injuries.

violations.description: Use of cluster munitions in populated areas constitutes an indiscriminate attack, violating international humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 3.3 Russia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.label: Russian Defense Ministry Denies Use of Cluster Munitions
events.description: Deputy chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, Anatoly Novogitsyn, stated that Russia had not used cluster munitions in the Georgian-Ossetian conflict area.

events.label: Russian Foreign Ministry Responds to Media Inquiry
events.description: A spokesman for the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs did not deny the use of cluster munitions but pointed out that Georgia has cluster warheads.

testimonies.excerpt: Witnesses told Human Rights Watch that Georgian troops were likely targets for a Russian cluster munitions strike.
International deminers concurred with Human Rights Watch’s conclusion that the cluster munitions strikes were Russian.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions
violations.description: Human Rights Watch concluded that Russian forces used cluster munitions in strikes on villages in Gori and Kareli districts.

chapter_title: 3.3 Russia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

events.description: A cluster munition strike hit the village of Variani, resulting in civilian casualties, including deaths and injuries.

testimonies.excerpt: The bomb fell from the air and it exploded. It happened in seconds and we all fell down. Both my legs were broken.
He still had shrapnel in his head and had difficulties speaking.

violations.description: Use of cluster munitions against populated areas constitutes indiscriminate use of force and is likely disproportionate.

testimonies.excerpt: I heard a jet. The bomb fell and exploded. I was wounded in the leg, chest, back, fingers.

events.label: First Cluster Munition Attack in Variani

events.label: Second Cluster Munition Attack
events.description: At the time of the second attack, Georgian troops had retreated from Tskhinvali and reportedly left Gori city.

testimonies.excerpt: [Contamination] has interfered with my harvest. I couldn’t collect because I couldn’t get into my fields because they were occupied [by troops].
Deminers cleared 27 submunitions from my cherry orchard.
Deminers had cleared four submunitions from my garden.
Deminers had cleared two submunitions from my home.
Two submunitions had been removed from my home.
I reported two explosions and six duds in my yard.
I reported four explosions and three duds in my and my neighbor’s yard.
There were troops in town at other times, but not at the time of this incident.

Planes were flying around and dropping bombs... We could feel the blast waves from the explosions.
The injured women and neighbors showed Human Rights Watch an Uragan rocket and 9N210 fragments.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions

testimonies.excerpt: There was a big explosion above us and the next moment there were many smaller explosions everywhere.
In a couple of seconds from everywhere I heard what sounded like massive gunfire. We fell on the ground and some people never got up.
My right leg was shredded as a result of the attack.

chapter_title: 3.4 Tank Attacks on Civilian Homes

events.label: Russian Tanks Fire on Tamarasheni
events.description: Russian tanks fired on homes in Tamarasheni, indicating indiscriminate attacks on civilian structures.

testimonies.excerpt: Three tanks would stand one after another, point their barrels in different directions and start shooting at houses.
I heard a big explosion and a big hole appeared in my house. I think it was tank fire.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks on Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces conducted attacks on civilian homes without distinguishing between military and civilian targets.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Aerial Attack on Civilian Convoy
events.description: Russian military aircraft attacked civilian convoys fleeing the conflict zone near Eredvi, resulting in casualties among non-combatants.

testimonies.excerpt: There were five people in our car. Suddenly [there was an] explosion. Perhaps four or five cars were hit... I saw that people were injured and killed. There was blood.

It was an aerial attack. There were five [Russian] planes. They first flew over once, then came back and opened fire, before they left... There were no military troops around. All the vehicles were civilian.

violations.label: Intentional Attack on Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces conducted aerial attacks on civilian vehicles without verifying military targets, constituting a violation of humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Attacks on Civilian Convoys near Eredvi
events.description: Explosions occurred near a civilian convoy traveling towards Georgian territory, likely caused by Russian forces.

testimonies.excerpt: I saw three explosions about 20 to 25 meters in front of the vehicle.
We fled Pkhvenisi after Russian forces attacked military targets, causing collateral damage to civilian homes.

violations.description: Attacks on civilian convoys violated international humanitarian law, potentially constituting a war crime.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

testimonies.excerpt: When we entered Variani I told Amiran to be careful because there were tanks in front. Then they started shooting at us. There was massive gunfire.

testimonies.excerpt: I was hiding behind the seat when I was wounded and ran into the tank.

section_title: They thought that I was dead. Then I ran away.328

testimonies.excerpt: I felt unsafe at the hospital and ran away. I had no information about my husband’s fate.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: Attack on taxi in Tedotsminda, August 12

events.label: Attack on Taxi by Russian Forces
events.description: Two women were killed when Russian forces fired on their taxi, which was traveling from Gori to Shindisi.

testimonies.excerpt: Russians fired without any kind of warning. The car turned over, but Russians still shot anti-tank missiles on it.
We saw an Opel taxi pass by... The tank apparently fired on the car, and the car went off the road, exploded and caught fire.
Russian troops denied an ambulance access to the area to collect the two women’s remains.

violations.label: Attack on Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces attacked a civilian taxi, resulting in the deaths of two women.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Russian Aircraft Attack Television Tower

events.label: Tank Fire on Civilians
events.description: As Khekhelashvili and Papuashvili were being driven back to the village, they encountered tanks that opened fire on their vehicle.

testimonies.excerpt: I felt a bullet skim the top of my head. Someone shouted, 'Get down!' and we all bent over.

violations.description: Civilians were fired upon by soldiers on tanks without warning.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

testimonies.excerpt: When they brought the body back we saw that there was a bullet wound to his forehead that had not been there when we left him—apparently a control shot.

violations.label: Control Shot on Deceased
violations.description: A bullet wound was found on the forehead of a deceased individual, indicating a potential execution after injury.

chapter_title: 3.6 Pillaging, Destruction, Violence, and Threats against Civilians

events.label: Russian Forces Conduct Violent Raid
events.description: Three Russian soldiers broke into Ilia Chulukidze's home, beat him, and searched for weapons.

testimonies.excerpt: They broke the door and one put a weapon in my face; others ran upstairs looking for something. They started beating me.

violations.description: Pillaging and violence against civilians by Russian forces and Ossetian militias.

chapter_title: 3.6 Pillaging, Destruction, Violence, and Threats against Civilians

testimonies.excerpt: Men in camouflage—presumably Ossetian militia fighters—arrived on Russian tanks in my village.

section_title: Karaleti (in Gori district), and torched his house:

events.label: Looting and Arson by Ossetians and Russian Forces
events.description: Armed Ossetians and Russian forces looted and set fire to the homes of Marine and Teimuraz Tetunashvili.

testimonies.excerpt: They jumped off and started shooting at the house. They said, 'Give us your cow and money.'
I was just begging them, 'Don’t kill me, take whatever you want, but don’t kill me!'

violations.description: Looting and burning of civilian homes.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

testimonies.excerpt: We’re now trying to stop the looters. They steal and set fire to things … I see no end to this.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

testimonies.excerpt: The Ossetians caught up to me and began beating me their fists and their gun butts and kicking me.… They had me at gunpoint.

violations.label: Destruction of Civilian Property
violations.description: Ossetian militias were reported to be burning civilian houses, which Russia failed to prevent.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

events.label: Russian Forces Establish Checkpoints in Gori
events.description: Russian forces set up checkpoints in the Gori district, limiting entry and exit while allowing civilians to pass after inspections.

testimonies.excerpt: The looting decreased when the Russian forces maintained a checkpoint in the village.
More frequent patrolling by the Russian forces or Georgian police would have improved security.
Looters seemed to be afraid to encounter the Russians and were hiding from them.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.1 Overview

testimonies.excerpt: Most able-bodied men in South Ossetia took up arms to protect their homes.
Many volunteer fighters joined the forces of the Ministry of Defense and Emergencies.

violations.description: South Ossetian forces committed war crimes, including murder, rape, torture, and inhuman treatment of civilians.
Deliberate destruction of Tbilisi-backed villages and systematic pillage and torching of houses.
Execution-style killings, rape, abductions, and beatings of civilians.
Torture of at least four Georgian prisoners of war and execution of at least three.

testimonies.excerpt: They put me into a car and made me watch them pour petrol everywhere in the rooms and outside and then set the house on fire.

events.label: Kokoity Confirms Village Destruction
events.description: Eduard Kokoity, president of South Ossetia, confirmed the destruction of Georgian villages, stating, 'We practically have flattened everything there.'

events.label: Gagloeva Discusses Looting Punishments
events.description: Irina Gagloeva stated that looters are rarely punished, often facing only minor fines for their actions.

testimonies.excerpt: The looters were pervasive and acted freely during daylight hours.
The looters aren’t really punished. If they’re caught by police at all this is processed as an administrative infraction.

violations.description: Widespread looting and torching of ethnic Georgian villages occurred without effective prevention or accountability.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 12.367 Two elderly women from Kekhvi wept as two days later they told Human Rights Watch
section_title: The Displaced Georgian Population’s Right to Return

events.label: Kokoity Assures No Discrimination for Georgians
events.description: Eduard Kokoity stated that displaced Georgians willing to return to South Ossetia would face no discrimination and have their security guaranteed.

events.label: Georgian School Burned in Alkhasheni
events.description: On the first day of classes after the summer break, a local Georgian school in Alkhasheni was burned by alleged militias.

testimonies.excerpt: The local Georgian school was burned by alleged militias.
The number of pupils had decreased from 50 to 15 by November.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 12.367 Two elderly women from Kekhvi wept as two days later they told Human Rights Watch

events.label: Thomas Hammerberg's Follow Up Mission
events.description: Thomas Hammerberg conducted a mission to assess the implementation of human rights and humanitarian protection principles in areas affected by the South Ossetia conflict.

violations.label: Destruction of Georgian Villages
violations.description: Ossetian and Russian authorities failed to hold accountable those responsible for the intentional destruction of Georgian villages.

events.label: Russian Forces Pass Through Tkviavi
events.description: On August 12, Russian forces moved through Tkviavi, leading to subsequent looting by armed groups.

events.label: Looting and Killings in Tkviavi
events.description: Several armed groups looted Tkviavi, resulting in the killing of three people, including Mikheil Melitauri and his brother.

testimonies.excerpt: Several armed men broke into my house... I could see the people in my yard beating my husband and his brother.

violations.label: Killing of Civilians During Looting
violations.description: Armed groups killed several civilians during a looting spree in Tkviavi.

events.label: Murder of Gela Chikhladze
events.description: Givi Chikhladze witnessed the murder of his brother Gela by Ossetian militias during an armed confrontation.

events.label: Looting and Arson in Tkviavi
events.description: Armed men stole Givi Chikhladze's tractor and attempted to burn down his house.

events.label: Death of Six Villagers
events.description: Givi Chikhladze identified six villagers who were killed in Tkviavi on August 12 or shortly thereafter.

testimonies.excerpt: I ran into the bathroom to get water in a bucket to put out the fire. With that, I saved the house.
They broke into the yard, they shot through the lock. My brother went to ask them to not burn down the house … And then I heard them shoot.
I was begging, 'Please shoot us, please just finish this off!' I was so terrified. I was crying.
I could hear my brother coughing, gasping for air. It was a horrible sound. The sound of death.

violations.label: Murder of Gela Chikhladze
violations.description: Gela Chikhladze was murdered by Ossetian militias.

violations.label: Looting and Arson
violations.description: Armed men looted property and attempted to set fire to a house in Tkviavi.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Home of Gela Chikhladze Burned
events.description: The home of Gela Chikhladze was burned down by Ossetian militia in Tkviavi.

violations.label: Destruction of Civilian Property
violations.description: The burning of Gela Chikhladze's home constitutes a violation of humanitarian law.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: The killing of Viktor Gagoshvili in Ergneti

events.label: Viktor Gagoshvili Shot and Killed
events.description: Viktor Gagoshvili was shot and killed in Ergneti by two armed Ossetian men who broke into a yard.

testimonies.excerpt: As the man ran in and sat down, we could see he was bleeding and had been shot in the back. He rolled over and died right there.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: When four villagers tried to take Gagoshvili to his house to bury him, they were apprehended by about 10 Ossetians who pointed and cocked their guns at them.

violations.label: Threatening civilians with firearms
violations.description: About 10 Ossetians threatened villagers with guns while they attempted to bury a deceased person.

violations.label: Destruction of property
violations.description: Neighbors informed Kasradze that his house was burned that night.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: The killing of Aliko Bibilashvili in Karaleti

events.label: Shooting Incident in Karaleti
events.description: Ossetian militia shot at Aliko Bibilashvili while he was sitting by the main road, resulting in his death.

testimonies.excerpt: We were sitting by the main road when the Ossetian militia drove by and shot at us.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: They fired at us and hit Aliko. Aliko fell and died soon after.

violations.label: Shooting at Civilians
violations.description: Shots were fired from a vehicle at civilians, resulting in the death of Aliko.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: The killing of Nora Kvinikadze in Abanoskoda

events.label: Killing of Nora Kvinikadze
events.description: Raul Kvinikadze described the killing of his 75-year-old grandmother by armed men.

events.label: Raul Visits Grandmother
events.description: Raul Kvinikadze visited his grandmother to help with the harvest.

testimonies.excerpt: I returned to my grandmother’s house and found that my father was being held by four armed men.

violations.label: Killing of Civilians
violations.description: The killing of Nora Kvinikadze by armed men constitutes a violation of humanitarian law.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Minibus Abduction Near Gori
events.description: Armed men stopped a minibus near Gori, confiscated cellphones, and abducted one passenger, Mariam C.

testimonies.excerpt: I felt terror during the abduction when armed men ordered us out of the minibus.
I saw that my grandmother was dead after she was shot.

violations.label: Rape of Ethnic Georgian Women
violations.description: Numerous reports of rape of ethnic Georgian women during the August 2008 war, constituting a grave breach of the Geneva Conventions.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: I immediately felt that something terrible was going to happen. Everyone was released but me.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: I sensed something terrible.… I immediately panicked. I was begging him not to do it, not to touch me. He just forced me onto the ground, slapped me several times, and raped me.

violations.label: Rape by Servicemen
violations.description: Mariam C. was raped by multiple men in military camouflage uniforms, who also threatened her life.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: The police officers confiscated my gold ring, earrings, and money, which they never returned.

violations.description: Confiscation of personal belongings without return.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Mariam C. Taken to Apartment
events.description: An unknown man promised to take Mariam C. home but instead took her to an apartment where she was treated well.

events.label: Mariam C. Handed Over to Authorities
events.description: Mariam C. was handed over to Georgian authorities during a prisoner exchange and sought medical care.

events.label: Eliso E. Family Attacked by Armed Men
events.description: Eliso E. and her family were threatened and attacked by armed men searching for military uniforms.

testimonies.excerpt: I was taken away by some men. Yes, very much so.
The armed men forced us to the second floor at gunpoint and beat me.

violations.label: Rape and Detention
violations.description: Mariam C. was raped and detained, suffering trauma as a result.

violations.label: Assault and Theft
violations.description: Eliso E. and her family were assaulted and robbed by armed men.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: Human Rights Watch interview with Mariam C.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: Name and exact location of her home withheld.

testimonies.excerpt: I started crying and praying. I was very scared. Then one man came back to my room.
One month has passed. I have headaches, fever. I have terrifying nightmares, thinking that they are coming up the steps to take me.

violations.label: Rape and Physical Assault
violations.description: Eliso E. was raped and physically assaulted by armed men who threatened her life.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Abduction of Natia B.
events.description: Lia B. witnessed her granddaughter Natia B. being abducted by two Ossetian men in broad daylight.

events.label: Lia B. Reports Abduction
events.description: Lia B. tearfully recounted the abduction of her granddaughter to Human Rights Watch.

testimonies.excerpt: I witnessed two Ossetian men abduct my 17-year-old granddaughter, Natia B., on August 13 in the middle of the day.

violations.description: Abductions violate the ban on unlawful confinement of a protected person as per article 147 of the Fourth Geneva Convention.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Abduction Attempt in Karaleti
events.description: An Ossetian man attempted to detain Zura Kareli and his family, shooting him in the hand and stealing his car with four villagers inside.

testimonies.excerpt: I begged them not to kill her. I screamed, 'Help me they are taking my child away!'
I had been kept alone in a run-down deserted building and given bread and water daily.
An Ossetian man wearing camouflage and with an automatic weapon attempted to detain me and my family.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: Pillage and Destruction of Civilian Property

testimonies.excerpt: The looting and destruction of our homes was devastating.
We saw the militias burning our village; it was horrifying.
The destruction in Tkviavi was extensive; everything was in ruins.

violations.label: Pillage and Destruction of Civilian Property
violations.description: Ossetian militias, with involvement from Russian forces, looted and destroyed homes in Georgian territory, constituting a war crime.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Destruction and Pillage in Gori District
events.description: Villages near the South Ossetian border experienced significant destruction and looting following the occupation by Russian troops.

events.label: Second Wave of Looting
events.description: A second wave of looting occurred in the last week of August, exacerbating the destruction in affected villages.

violations.label: Pillage and Destruction of Property
violations.description: The destruction of property and pillage in villages was a violation of humanitarian law, as it was not justified by military necessity.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Armed Ossetians Loot Tkviavi
events.description: Several groups of armed Ossetians arrived in Tkviavi with Russian forces and stayed to loot and burn civilian property.

testimonies.excerpt: I stayed in the village during the conflict.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: They asked, 'Where are the cars? Where are the people? Where are the big houses in the village?' I just said, 'Take anything you want, but please don’t shoot.'
The looters were mostly taking away cars, and money from some well-to-do houses as well.
After Russian checkpoints were established here, the massive looting stopped, but they kept coming during the night.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Russian Airstrike on Tkviavi
events.description: Russian military aircraft bombed a neighborhood in Tkviavi, causing significant destruction.

testimonies.excerpt: Local residents provided detailed statements about the looting and destruction of property in Megvrekisi.
Local residents provided detailed statements about the looting and destruction of property in Megvrekisi.
Local residents provided detailed statements about the looting and destruction of property in Megvrekisi.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: They came on a tank. If a family wasn’t home, they would break the gates of the house with a tank, enter the houses—they were mainly looking for arms and ammunition.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Home of Elizabeta Naskidashvili Set on Fire
events.description: The home of 78-year-old Elizabeta Naskidashvili was set on fire by militias while she was away, resulting in significant damage.

events.label: Assault and Looting of Leila Tetunashvili's House
events.description: Ossetian militia assaulted 65-year-old Leila Tetunashvili and looted her house.

testimonies.excerpt: They were shooting at houses from a long weapon and immediately after, the house would catch fire.

violations.label: Deliberate Destruction of Property
violations.description: Ossetian looters deliberately burned 16 houses in Tirdznisi village.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Russian Troops and Militia Pass Through Dvani
events.description: On August 8, Russian troops, followed by Ossetian militia and Cossacks, passed through Dvani, leading to looting and destruction.

events.label: Otiashvili Returns to Find House Burned
events.description: Vasili Otiashvili returned to Dvani on August 27 to find his house burned to the ground, estimating at least 30 houses had been destroyed.

testimonies.excerpt: They were counting the time that I had left before they would shoot me unless I gave them money and gold.
Ossetians came, three of them, all armed with automatic guns. They pointed the gun at our head and demanded our car keys.
My neighbor’s house was looted that day; two days later I fled.

violations.label: Armed Robbery and Threats
violations.description: Armed Ossetians threatened civilians, demanding money and valuables under the threat of violence.

violations.label: Looting and Destruction of Property
violations.description: Russian troops and Ossetian militia looted homes and burned down houses in Dvani.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Looting in Koshka
events.description: Russian and Ossetian forces began looting in Koshka over two days.

events.label: Continued Looting in Koshka
events.description: Looting continued in Koshka as Russian forces failed to provide security.

testimonies.excerpt: Russian forces failed to provide security in the areas under their effective control.
Russian forces failed to provide security in the areas under their effective control.
Russian forces failed to provide security in the areas under their effective control.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Looting Incident in Koshka
events.description: Four armed Ossetians returned to Koshka and forced a resident to help them loot a neighbor's house.

testimonies.excerpt: They were not members of the South Ossetian forces, but simply robbers from the ethnic Ossetian village of Khelchua.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: South Ossetia. He told Human Rights Watch,

testimonies.excerpt: They approached us, shooting in the air, and said, 'You weren’t happy with a peaceful life—now we’re going to show you!'

violations.label: Beating and Looting by Armed Individuals
violations.description: Armed individuals beat civilians and looted their property, including a fridge and clothes.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Violence in Megvrekisi
events.description: Ossetian militias entered Megvrekisi, resulting in one person being beaten and another killed.

events.label: Residents Flee Megvrekisi
events.description: Numerous residents fled Megvrekisi due to the deteriorating security situation following looting and violence.

events.label: Residents Flee Nikozi
events.description: Residents of Nikozi also fled due to the ongoing violence and looting by Ossetian militias.

testimonies.excerpt: I left the village [on August 26]. We left because [on August 24] Ossetians came into the village, beat one person and killed another one.

violations.label: Looting and Burning of Houses
violations.description: Ossetian militias looted and burned houses in Megvrekisi and Nikozi.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Houses Burned in Karaleti
events.description: Three houses were burned in Karaleti, with the fire starting from the inside and leading to the roofs collapsing.

testimonies.excerpt: I saw how three houses were burned. Within one hour they were completely burned.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Dmitri Abukidze Detained
events.description: Dmitri Abukidze and his father were detained in Tseronisi and placed in an armored personnel carrier.

events.label: Looting Continues in Knolevi
events.description: Residents reported ongoing looting and theft of livestock and valuables in Knolevi by Ossetian looters.

events.label: Destruction of Houses Reported
events.description: Residents reported that Ossetians had looted and burned 29 houses in Knolevi, 6 in Avlevi, and about 42 in Tseronisi.

testimonies.excerpt: [The Ossetians] just fired from their grenade launcher at the houses, from a distance, and the houses would immediately catch fire.
They are still coming—yesterday [August 22], for example, they were here. They are taking away cars, cattle, and valuable things like fridges.

violations.label: Arson and Theft by Ossetian Militias
violations.description: Ossetian militias fired grenade launchers at homes, setting them on fire, and stole livestock from local residents.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Russian Forces Occupy South Ossetia
events.description: Russian forces began to occupy South Ossetia, leading to the detention of residents in ethnic Georgian villages.

events.label: Detention of Residents in Georgian Villages
events.description: South Ossetian forces, sometimes with Russian forces, detained at least 159 residents in ethnic Georgian villages.

testimonies.excerpt: Detainees told Human Rights Watch that they were not given reasons for their detention and did not have access to lawyers.
A young boy named Giorgi, detained together with his father, was held in the South Ossetian Ministry of Interior building.
Detainees described ill-treatment during detention and in custody.

violations.label: Illegal Detentions and Ill-Treatment
violations.description: The detention of residents without reasons and the ill-treatment during custody amount to grave breaches of the Geneva Conventions.

violations.label: Execution of Detainee
violations.description: At least one man was executed while in Ossetian custody during his transfer to the Ministry of Interior.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

violations.description: Russian and Ossetian forces detained ethnic Georgians and subjected them to beatings before handing them over to police.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: All of those detained by Ossetian and Russian forces stated that they were civilians not participating in the hostilities.

violations.label: Grave breaches of the Fourth Geneva Convention
violations.description: Willful killing, torture, and inhuman treatment are considered war crimes under the Fourth Geneva Convention.

violations.label: Prohibition on torture and inhuman treatment
violations.description: The ICCPR and ECHR provide an absolute prohibition on torture and degrading treatment applicable to the detentions.

testimonies.excerpt: Ethnic Georgians were detained for their personal safety; the Ministry of Interior was protecting them and saving their lives.

violations.label: Unlawful Confinement of Protected Persons
violations.description: The unlawful confinement of protected persons, such as civilians, is considered a war crime.

violations.description: Human Rights Watch documented the execution of one man during his transfer to the Ministry of Interior.
