events.label: Ossetian Forces Enter Kekhvi
events.description: Ossetian forces entered the village of Kekhvi, prompting local residents to flee.

events.label: Nebieridze Detained at Gunpoint
events.description: Shermadin Nebieridze was forced into a neighbor's yard at gunpoint by armed Ossetian forces.

testimonies.excerpt: I begged them, 'Please don’t kill me. I haven’t done anything. I am an elderly man.'

violations.label: Use of Threatening Force
violations.description: Ossetian forces threatened Shermadin Nebieridze with a weapon and physically assaulted him.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Ossetian Forces Enter Zemo Achabeti
events.description: South Ossetian forces entered the village of Zemo Achabeti, leading to the detention and ill-treatment of local residents.

testimonies.excerpt: They picked me up and walked me out of the yard.
Why the fuck are you not leaving this place!?
Come with us now, or you will all be killed.

violations.label: Ill-treatment during detention
violations.description: South Ossetian forces subjected Ilo Khabareli and Salimat Bagaeva to physical abuse and threats during their detention.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: Ministry of Interior building in Tskhinvali.485

events.label: Russian and Ossetian Soldiers Enter Yard
events.description: Two Russian soldiers and two Ossetian soldiers entered Nunu Gogidze's yard and demanded she come with them, shooting at the ground when she asked for her documents.

events.label: House Looted and Set on Fire
events.description: On the same day, three or four Ossetians looted the house of Tamar Khutsinashvili and set it on fire.

testimonies.excerpt: They shot at the ground in front of my feet.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: I was terrified. I told them, ‘Kill us here if you want.’ One Ossetian hit me on the head with a gun butt and cursed me.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Tamaz Chalauri Flees and is Detained
events.description: Tamaz Chalauri fled his home and was detained by Ossetians who forced him and others out of a minivan, leading to violence and a fatal shooting.

events.label: Ossetians Demand Information in Tirdznisi
events.description: Ossetians entered Tirdznisi demanding information about detained Ossetians and detained several residents, including Dmitri Abukidze.

testimonies.excerpt: I got out and they hit me in the stomach with the butt of a gun. They were swearing at us … saying, 'You pigs, you killed so many of our people. Now we will kill you.'
One big Ossetian man in heavy boots was stomping on my ankle in order to try to force me to raise my head.
Then all at once one of them loaded his gun and shot the young man twice in the head to kill him.
They started moving, and some 30 minutes later I managed to jump off. They fired at me from an automatic gun, and hit me in the leg.

violations.label: Ill-treatment and Execution of Detainees
violations.description: Ossetian forces executed a young man and subjected detainees to physical abuse and threats.

violations.label: Detention of Civilians
violations.description: Ossetians detained Dmitri Abukidze and others, threatening them and using violence.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: All of the detainees interviewed described appalling conditions of detention in small, overcrowded basement cells.
Many detainees described degrading treatment, particularly upon arrival at the facility.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: Several detainees told Human Rights Watch that Russian Federation officials were present at certain times at the Ministry of Interior during their detention.

violations.label: Ill-treatment and War Crimes
violations.description: Ill-treatment and willfully causing great suffering or serious injury to body or health constitute war crimes.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Detention and Abuse at Ministry of Interior
events.description: Tamaz Chalauri and others were detained by Ossetian forces, subjected to searches, beatings, and humiliation.

testimonies.excerpt: They lined us up facing the wall... They were hitting us, kicking us, cursing us the whole time.
Kill me here because I won’t do that.
When I tried to walk around the flag, Ossetians hit me with the butt of a gun.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Questioning by Russian Officials
events.description: David Giunashvili reported being questioned by men in uniforms with Russian Prosecutor General insignia.

events.label: Interrogation by Russian Military
events.description: Tamaz Chalauri stated he was questioned by individuals in military uniform who spoke only Russian.

events.label: Detention at Russian Military Base
events.description: Emilia Lapachi was detained and kept at a Russian military base before being transferred for interrogation.

events.label: Interrogation by Russian Vice-Colonel
events.description: Emilia Lapachi was interrogated by someone introducing himself as a Russian vice-colonel.

testimonies.excerpt: We saw them being taken upstairs and we could hear their screams. When they were brought back, they would bear clear signs of beating.
Young men would be taken out and then badly beaten. I saw them. Their bodies would be covered in bruises.

violations.label: Beatings of Detainees
violations.description: Former detainees reported that many young men were beaten frequently, showing clear signs of abuse.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: There wasn’t even space to walk around in the corridor or in the exercise yard due to the large number of people.
Detainees stated that the basement contained five dark, dirty, poorly ventilated cells without windows.
Detainees were held in separate cells, which quickly became overcrowded.
The guards eventually opened the doors of the cells and detainees could move into the hall.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: In my cell, the women were sleeping like herrings in a tin.
People slept in shifts because there was not enough space for people to lie down.
The toilet was a big problem. There was only one and there was always a long line for it.

violations.description: Detainees were subjected to inhumane living conditions, including overcrowding and insufficient food and water.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: I volunteered to work on some days to be out of the overcrowded cells for a few hours.
I volunteered to work on some days to be out of the overcrowded cells for a few hours.

violations.label: Forced Labor of Detainees
violations.description: Ossetian forces forced male detainees to work without compensation, violating humanitarian law.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: They would take us out at 9 a.m. until late evening. We were cleaning the streets. We had to clear dead bodies from the street.
We cleaned the street, threw out garbage, and removed and buried the dead. We buried about 44 people.
I was forced to work for two days lifting coffins off trucks and placing them in graves. I estimate that we buried 50 bodies.

violations.label: Forced Labor
violations.description: Individuals were forced to work under degrading conditions without compensation, violating humanitarian law.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

testimonies.excerpt: They were cursing, swearing, calling us sons of bitches, pigs, whores.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory
section_title: ICRC, journalist visits to the facility

testimonies.excerpt: We were told by the guards that … if we wanted to be released, we should tell them that we had been treated well and that we had no complaints.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces

events.label: Prisoner Exchange Initiated
events.description: Ossetian forces released 61 detainees, including elderly and women, in exchange for eight militia fighters.

events.label: Final Group of Civilians Released
events.description: A final group of 81 civilians was released in exchange for four detainees and nine Ossetians serving sentences in Georgia.

events.label: Detainees Transferred to Tskhinvali
events.description: Four Georgian men were transferred to a military base in Tskhinvali after being detained by Ossetian forces.

testimonies.excerpt: We were detained by armed Ossetian men and beaten upon capture.
They forced us to kneel next to the bodies of two Georgian men.

violations.label: Use of Prisoners as Hostages
violations.description: It is prohibited to use prisoners as hostages to compel the enemy to act or abstain from acting.

violations.label: Population Transfer Prohibition
violations.description: Using prisoner exchanges as a means of effecting population transfer is prohibited under international law.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Detainees Taken to Ministry of Interior
events.description: On August 11 or 12, two men in blue and white camouflage uniforms transported the detainees to the South Ossetian Ministry of Interior.

testimonies.excerpt: I was beaten with rifle butts.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Detention of Eremov and Kebadze
events.description: Nikoloz Eremov and Vazha Kebadze were detained by Russian military in Variani and taken to a military base in Tskhinvali.

events.label: Mindiashvili Flees Bombing
events.description: Sergo Mindiashvili fled Nikozi due to bombing and was detained at an Ossetian checkpoint in Shindisi.

testimonies.excerpt: The Ossetians would beat me on the legs and on the shoulders with their gun butts, and the Russian officer would ask questions.
They threatened to kill me if I didn’t do as they said. They pointed a gun at me.

violations.label: Torture and Ill-treatment
violations.description: Eremov and Kebadze were subjected to beatings and torture by Russian and Ossetian forces during their detention.

violations.label: Threat to Life
violations.description: Mindiashvili was threatened with death by Ossetian forces during his detention.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.3 South Ossetian Abuses in Undisputed Georgian Territory

events.label: Mindiashvili Detained and Beaten
events.description: Sergo Mindiashvili was detained by Ossetian forces, beaten, and questioned about Georgian military locations before being handed over to Russian soldiers.

testimonies.excerpt: They started questioning me, but I was beaten good first. They didn’t explain why I had been detained.

violations.label: Beating and Threat of Execution
violations.description: Mindiashvili was beaten and threatened with execution by Ossetian forces during his detention.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

events.label: Georgian Soldiers Captured by Ossetian Forces
events.description: At least 13 Georgian military servicemen were detained by Ossetian forces during active fighting in Tskhinvali.

events.label: Exchange of Georgian POWs for Russian POWs
events.description: Russian authorities exchanged 13 Georgian prisoners of war for five Russian prisoners of war.

events.label: Russia Gains Effective Control of Tskhinvali
events.description: Russia exercised effective control over Tskhinvali, impacting the treatment of Georgian POWs.

testimonies.excerpt: They kicked us, cursed us, and beat us with the butts of their guns.
They were beating us and swearing at us, saying, ‘You pigs, why did you come here [to Tskhinvali]?’
I had no idea that Ossetian forces and others, including the group of Georgian POWs, were there.

violations.label: Torture and Ill-treatment of POWs
violations.description: Georgian soldiers reported severe torture and ill-treatment during their detention by Ossetian forces.

violations.label: Execution of Georgian Servicemen
violations.description: Three Georgian servicemen were executed while in the custody of Ossetian forces.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

events.label: Transfer of POWs to School No. 6
events.description: On the morning of August 10, eight POWs were transferred by Ossetian captors to a school on the outskirts of Tskhinvali after being held for two nights.

testimonies.excerpt: Anyone who wanted to beat us, beat us. I fainted several times because I had already lost so much blood.
When we got to the square, whoever wanted to beat us, beat us … They kicked and punched us.

violations.label: Beating and Humiliation of POWs
violations.description: The Ossetian forces and civilians beat and humiliated the POWs during their transfer through Tskhinvali.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

testimonies.excerpt: They took us to the very center of the city, where many people beat us: Ossetian militia, local residents, Ossetian troops, anyone who wanted to…
Some of us lost consciousness. When we lost consciousness [some of the attackers] would urinate on our faces to wake us up and began beating us again.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

testimonies.excerpt: First they beat us outside of the school. Ten or fifteen people would come and beat us, then another group. Someone broke my rib.

violations.label: Beating of POWs
violations.description: Ossetian forces and civilians beat prisoners of war upon their arrival at the school.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

testimonies.excerpt: They called the tank gunner out into a small room and then we heard shooting. Quite a lot of machine gun fire.
Some kind of tarp or tent lay on the floor and, from the position of the body lying on the tarp, it seemed that he had been kneeling at the edge of the tarp when they shot him.
One [of the prisoners], a tank gunner, was taken away by some of the captors.

violations.label: Execution of POW
violations.description: The Ossetian captors executed a Georgian tank gunner after singling him out from other POWs.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

events.label: Khubulov Taken by Captors
events.description: On August 11, POWs witnessed Khubulov being singled out and led away by captors, who threatened him due to his Ossetian surname.

testimonies.excerpt: I’m going to kill you now,” said a Russian soldier, but another intervened, claiming I reminded him of his son.
We [killed him] because he was an Ossetian traitor,” said one of the captors about Khubulov.

violations.label: Threats and Beatings of POWs
violations.description: POWs were threatened with death and beaten by their captors, including the specific case of Khubulov being targeted for his ethnicity.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

events.label: Extrajudicial Killing of Georgian Soldier
events.description: A South Ossetian law enforcement officer described the execution of a Georgian armed man following a sweep operation in Tamarasheni.

testimonies.excerpt: A Chechen fighter said that traitors had to be punished, and took him out in the yard and just shot him.
We executed him. He was the one who killed our guys.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces

events.label: Transfer of POWs to Ossetian Police
events.description: Ossetian captors transferred a group of prisoners to the Ossetian Ministry of Interior.

events.label: Zaza Kavtiashvili Transferred to Russian Forces
events.description: Injured POW Zaza Kavtiashvili was transferred to Russian forces after being interrogated and beaten by Ossetian forces.

testimonies.excerpt: They would beat me, question me, then beat me, all the while also insulting and humiliating me.
We did not know what to do with all these prisoners and just passed them on to the [Ossetian] Ministry of Interior.
The Ossetian forces had identical 'star-shaped badges on their belts' and were possibly special forces.

violations.label: Beating and Humiliation of POWs
violations.description: Ossetian forces beat and humiliated Zaza Kavtiashvili during interrogation.

events.label: Georgian POWs Exchanged
events.description: Zaza Kavtiashvili was exchanged with other Georgian POWs after being held in custody.

events.label: Georgian POWs Handed Over
events.description: Several Georgian POWs were handed over to Russian troops after being held by Ossetian police.

testimonies.excerpt: They beat me with chairs, metal sticks, and the butts of guns. They broke my right arm.
They beat us regularly. Five or seven guys would come into the cell, beat us, get tired, go out, rest, come back, beat us.
Three Ossetians would come regularly, beat us for five, ten, fifteen minutes, leave, come back again.
They beat us with chairs, belts, and ropes, and when the shovel broke, they used the handle.

violations.label: Torture of Georgian POWs
violations.description: Georgian POWs were subjected to torture and severe ill-treatment while in Ossetian police custody.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

testimonies.excerpt: Russian journalists were allowed to film the Georgian soldiers and asked them their names, ages, and how they were being treated.

events.label: Georgian Soldiers Transferred to Russian Forces
events.description: Ossetian police transferred Malachini, Kutashvili, and Zirakishvili to Russian forces, who took them to a base.

events.label: Georgian Soldiers Returned in POW Exchange
events.description: Malachini, Zirakishvili, and Kutashvili were transferred to Georgian custody in exchange for Russian POWs.

testimonies.excerpt: By that time I couldn’t really even move my arms. My feet dragged. My legs and arms were so swollen. I was trembling all over.
We couldn’t even really stand or walk. We leaned on each other in order to move.

part_title: Part 4. Violations by South Ossetian Forces
chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

testimonies.excerpt: I don’t sleep at night. I have nightmares. I wake up and think that this will happen to me again.

chapter_title: 4.5 Execution, Torture, and Other Degrading Treatment of Georgian

section_title: Footage on file with Human Rights Watch.

testimonies.excerpt: I had a broken rib and damage and swelling to one lung, along with pain in my ankles, back, sides, and chest.
I was still in hospital more than three weeks after my release.

events.description: Zaza Kavtiashvili was shot during street fighting, resulting in a shattered kneecap.

events.label: Kakha Zirakishvili Interviewed
events.description: Kakha Zirakishvili was interviewed by Human Rights Watch about his experiences during the conflict.

testimonies.excerpt: I have a broken rib. I have a broken bone in my right hand and [two broken bones] in my fingers.
I was beaten and have many bruises and several head wounds from the beatings.
I lose sense of reality, a sense of where I am. The doctors say there may be some serious head trauma.

violations.description: Zaza Kavtiashvili was shot and beaten by Ossetian police, resulting in severe injuries.

part_title: Part 5: International Scrutiny of Rights Violations in

events.label: EU Commissioned Inquiry into Conflict
events.description: The European Union commissioned a six-month inquiry into the conflict, led by Heidi Tagliavini, to examine its origins and course with respect to international law.

events.label: Final Report Due to Present
events.description: The final report of the inquiry into the conflict is due to be presented to the EU, UN, OSCE, Russia, and Georgia.

events.label: Council of Europe Human Rights Reports
events.description: The Council of Europe commissioner for human rights published a report assessing the human rights situation in Georgia and Russia regarding the conflict.

events.label: Six Principles for Human Rights Protection
events.description: The commissioner set out six principles for the protection of human rights in the context of the conflict, focusing on displaced persons and the need for demining.

testimonies.excerpt: The August war will only be a small part of the final report, which will also look at the events of the early 1990s.
